title:
Stringy scaling of multi-tensor hard string scattering amplitudes and
  the K-identities
authors: Sheng-Hong Lai, Jen-Chi Lee and Yi Yang
abstract:
We calculate n-point hard string scattering amplitudes (HSSA) with n-2
tachyons and 2 tensor states at arbitrary mass levels. We discover the stringy
scaling behavior of these HSSA. It is found that for HSSA with more than 2
transverse directions, the degree of stringy scaling dimM2 decreases comparing
to the degree of stringy scaling dimM1 of the n-1 tachyons and 1 tensor HSSA
calculated previously. Moreover, we propose a set of K-identities which is the
key to demonstrate the stringy scaling behavior of HSSA. We explicitly prove
both the diagonal and off-diagonal K-identities for the 4-point HSSA and give
numerical proofs of these K-identities for some higher point HSSA.
